features.description: Cleavage; by caspase-6; when associated with variant 670-N-L-671
Cleavage; by caspase-6, caspase-8 or caspase-9
Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in ubiquitin)
in a patient with late onset Alzheimer disease
in AD1; Flemish mutation; increases the solubility of processed beta-amyloid peptides and increases the stability of peptide oligomers
in one chronic schizophrenia patient; unknown pathological significance; dbSNP:rs1800557
in AD1; increased beta-APP42/ beta-APP40 ratio
in AD1; decreased beta-APP40/ total APP-beta
Binds copper. No dimer formation. No copper reducing activity
Some decrease in copper reducing activity
Greatly reduced copper-mediated low-density lipoprotein oxidation
Greatly reduced copper-mediated low-density lipoprotein oxidation
Reduced affinity for heparin; when associated with A-503
Reduced affinity for heparin; when associated with A-499
Abolishes chondroitin sulfate binding in L-APP733 isoform
Reduced protein oxidation. No hippocampal neuron toxicity
No free radical production. No hippocampal neuron toxicity
Increased beta-APP42/beta-APP40 ratio. No change in apoptosis after caspase cleavage
No effect on APBA1 nor APBB1 binding. Greatly reduces the binding to APPBP2. APP internalization unchanged. No change in beta-APP42 secretion
No cleavage by caspases during apoptosis
Greatly reduces the binding to SHC1 and APBB family members; no effect on NGF-stimulated neurite extension
Reduced NGF-stimulated neurite extension. No effect on APP maturation
APP internalization unchanged. No change in beta-APP42 secretion
Little APP internalization. Reduced beta-APP42 secretion
Loss of binding to MAPK8IP1, APBA1, APBB1, APPBP2 and SHC1
No binding to APBA1, no effect on APBB1 binding. Little APP internalization. Reduced beta-APP42 secretion
Little APP internalization. Reduced beta-APP42 secretion
Loss of binding to APBA1 and APBB1. APP internalization unchanged. No change in beta-APP42 secretion
